concept_data.title: Economic Community of Central African States

summary: The Economic Community of Central African States (ECCAS) is an intergovernmental organization aimed at promoting economic integration and cooperation among its member states. Established to enhance regional stability and development, ECCAS seeks to foster trade, investment, and sustainable development within Central Africa. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, ECCAS may serve as a partner for collaboration on issues such as trade agreements, development aid, and regional security initiatives. The EU recognizes the importance of such extra-European organisations in achieving broader geopolitical objectives and enhancing cooperation in international law and economic governance.
